showScoreExcerpt:
A play set in Maryland in the 1960s and '70s has assumed a timeless quality, largely because Vogel allows her characters their full humanity while refusing to excuse their crimes. Thanks to the brilliance of its construction and the power of its insights, you can call it, without contradiction, a modern masterpiece. In a program note, Vogel wonders if any of her future writing will ever touch so many lives; it's a very good question.
